snippet: In the summer of 1986 Bernard King used some uninvited guests to one of his rehab practices to send the Knicks a message: don’t count him out.
abstract: Harvey Araton Off The Dribble column holds that former NBA forward Bernard King's induction into Basketball Hall of Fame cements one of greatest comebacks in history of the sport; notes that King's back-to-back 50-point games with New York Knicks occurred after his recovery from knee injury and great personal strife.
lead_paragraph: In the summer of 1986 Bernard King used some uninvited guests to one of his rehab practices to send the Knicks a message: don’t count him out.

headline.seo: Bernard King’s Induction Completes One of Basketball’s Great Comebacks
headline.main: Hall Election Completes One of Game’s Great Comebacks
headline.print_headline: Hall Induction Completes One of Game’s Great Comebacks
